Velāmika，（adj．） [velāma+ika，the word velāma probably a district word] “belonging to Velāma，” at D．II，198 used as a clan-name （f．Velāmikānī），with vv．ll．Vessinī & Vessāyinī （cp．Velāma Np．combd with Vessantara at VbhA．414），and at D．II，333 classed with khujjā， vāmanikā & komārikā （trsln “maidens”； Bdhgh：“very young & childish”：see Dial．II．359）； v．l．celāvikā．They are some sort of servants，esp．in demand for a noble’s retinue．See also Np．Velāma （the V．‹-› sutta at J．I，228 sq．）．（Page 650）
